p: All experimental animals were used in accordance with established guidelines (Revised NIH Publications 1978, No. 8023) and ethical approval of the Committee on Care and Use of Experimental Animal Resources, College of Medicine, Ekiti State University, Ado Ekiti, Nigeria. Forty wistar albino rats with mean weight of 170 g were purchased from the animal breeding colony of the Department of Science Technology, Federal Polytechnic, Ado - Ekiti. Eight groups of five animals per group were created as described in Table 1. Experimental animals were accomondated in separate cages made of iron- meshed at ambient temperature (24 ± 1 °C), relative humidity, and 12/12-h light and dark cycle. Animals were given unrestricted daily access to food and drinking water ad libitum. Throughout the experimental period, rat beddings were routinely turned-over on a daily basis to maintain good hygiene.
